title: Grover's Search Algorithm
description: Comprehensive exploration of Grover's quantum search algorithm, from basic principles to advanced applications.

items.title: Introduction to Grover
items.description: Learn the fundamental principles of Grover's quantum search algorithm and how it achieves quadratic speedup over classical search.

concepts.title: Quantum Search Problem
concepts.description: Understanding the unstructured search problem and why classical algorithms require O(N) time.
concepts.mathematical_foundation: Search space of N items, finding marked items with probability 1

concepts.title: Oracle Function
concepts.description: Learn how to construct quantum oracles that mark target items in the search space.
concepts.mathematical_foundation: O|x⟩ = (-1)^f(x)|x⟩ where f(x) = 1 for marked items

concepts.title: Amplitude Amplification
concepts.description: The core mechanism that amplifies the probability amplitude of marked states.

concepts.title: Quadratic Speedup
concepts.description: Why Grover's algorithm achieves O(√N) complexity instead of classical O(N).

items.title: Quantum Counting Algorithm
items.description: Explore the quantum counting algorithm that determines the number of marked items without knowing them beforehand, extending Grover's search capabilities.

concepts.title: Quantum Phase Estimation
concepts.description: Using quantum phase estimation to extract eigenvalue information from Grover's diffusion operator.
concepts.mathematical_foundation: QPE extracts eigenvalues e^(iθ) from unitary operators

concepts.title: Grover Eigenvalues
concepts.description: Understanding the eigenvalue structure of Grover's iteration operator.

concepts.title: Counting Without Knowing
concepts.description: Determining the number of solutions without prior knowledge of their identity.
concepts.mathematical_foundation: m = N sin²(θ/2) derived from phase estimation

concepts.title: Error Analysis
concepts.description: Precision and error bounds in quantum counting algorithms.
concepts.mathematical_foundation: Error scales as O(1/2^k) for k-bit phase estimation
